sub_title: GNSS engineer and operations manager at the Galileo Reference Centre | TU Delft Cum Laude
summary:
Dynamic and ambitious, promoter of well-defined goals and responsibilities ownership. A multidisciplinary engineer who enjoys working with international teams and pro-actively steps beyond the comfort zones.

Raised in Spain, Belgium, and Germany, I have become synonymous with adaptability to varied environments and multi-cultural cooperation. This exposure has also given me an adaptive leadership that thrives most notably in interdisciplinary challenges and international environments.

Space science had always fascinated me and I took every chance to pursue this field throughout my engineering education. My thesis in low-thrust trajectory optimization led to an award-winning novel approach and, besides my passion for software engineering and simulations, I've actively participated in small satellite developments for Earth Observation. On the professional domain, I've had the honour to work at three space agencies on state-of-the-art subjects such as space surveillance and awareness, and global navigation satellite systems. This latter experience as aerospace engineering consultant has additionally given me a proven affinity for relationships management and foostering cooperation under high pressure. 

My ambition is to combine my all-rounded technical skillset with my passion to empower the people around me while never settling and taking on innovative challenges. Moreover, my personal interests also include scientific outreach, education, phylantropy, and sports. Feel free to also reach out to me for social causes, entrepreneurship, and investment opportunities too.

Talk to you soon!
David

awards.title: First award in the student competition at the 11th IAA Symposium
awards.description: Oral presentation and full paper published in the proceedings of the 11th IAA Symposium on Small Satellites for Earth Observation (Berlin, 2017). I co-wrote the paper and co-presented the project in the student competition, which was open to BSc, MSc, and PhD students. The project was awarded the first price by the IAA.

awards.title: Best Science Proposal and Best Presentation Award
awards.description:
"The jury found that the science case presented by the WAVE-E mission concept was the most convincing. The team identified a poorly understood but important region in the atmosphere: the Upper Thermosphere and Lower Stratosphere (the UTLS), that has a significant influence on both weather and climate. They proposed to investigate this region and to complement observations made by operational missions. The mission will bring a better understanding of the processes in this region, and also in the tropopause, the boundary between the troposphere and the stratosphere.

The jury was also impressed by the clear structure of the presentation and the consistent deduction of mission objectives, mission requirements, and the stated mission objectives including the needs of international bodies like IPCC. The clear and detailed presentation of the payload and mission design including budgets and technology readiness was supported by a range of media resources. The jury also witnessed engagement, spontaneity, and responsiveness to the audience’s questions."
awards.issuer: Roger Bonnet, Chairman of the Alpbach Summer School Jury

awards.title: Third award in the student competition at the 10th IAA Symposium
awards.description: Oral presentation and full paper published in the proceedings of the 10th IAA Symposium on Small Satellites for Earth Observation (Berlin, 2015). I co-presented the project in the student competition, which was open to BSc, MSc, and PhD students. The project was awarded the third price and 1000 € by the IAA.

awards.title: Best Bachelor Thesis at TU Delft
awards.description: Presented my BSc graduation project to the jury of the UfD-DAMEN fundation. Received one of the four awards given to the best TU Delft BSc. projects in 2014.
awards.issuer: DAMEN in partnership with Universiteit Fonds Delft

awards.title: Cum Laude BSc Aerospace Engineering
awards.description: For completing every course in the BSc of Aerospace Engineering at TU Delft within nominal time and with top 90% grades of all students.

awards.title: School's Best Ambassador
awards.description: Yearly award given to the best ambassador among the graduating students, someone with a profound international understanding who best represents the values of the institution through self-initiative and extracurricular projects.

projects.title: PoPSat - The Polar Preecipitation Satellite Mission
projects.description: The terrestrial water cycle is a unique system on planet Earth. It is directly influenced by our changing climate with most drastic effects in the polar regions. A main element of the water cycle is precipitation, and it is only very sparsely observed at high latitudes. We propose a new satellite mission, PoPSat, to observe snow and light rain at high latitudes, as well as snowfall at mid latitudes. The satellite shall be equipped with a dual band (Ka and W bands) phased array antenna radar and provide 3D information about precipitation and clouds. The horizontal resolution of 2 km shall exceed all other observations, and the measurements at high latitudes, together with the capability to monitor snowfall, shall complement the GPM mission's observations. By filling this gap, PoPSat shall provide essential data for improving global weather and climate models.

projects.title: Water Vapour European Explorer (WAVE-E)
projects.description: This project presents the concept conceived by Team Green at Alpbach Summer School 2016, a nine-day design challenge devoted to ‘Satellite Observations of the Global Water Cycle’. We propose the WAter Vapour European - Explorer (WAVE-E) satellite mission to monitor water vapour in the UTLS. It consists of three small satellites that will be put in sun-synchronous low earth orbits. The main instrument is a limb-sounding and cross-track scanning mid-infrared passive spectrometer (824 cm -1 to 829 cm -1 ) providing measurements over the UTLS region at a 1 km vertical resolution and 25 km horizontal resolution. Synergistic use of WAVE-E and MetOp-NG operational satellites is identified. Data fusion retrieval algorithms can provide water vapour profiles from the surface to the lower stratosphere.

projects.title: HIRES: Holland’s Intelligence, Reconnaissance, and Earth Surveillance satellite
projects.description:
The mission statement read: "To provide the Royal Dutch Air Force (RNLAF) with an independent space resource to obtain Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) information about any specific Earth location, from 2017 onwards.".

As bachelor thesis project, we developed a Phase 0/A conceptual satellite design, in a team of 10 people through a period of 10 weeks (full-time). For the RNALF, this served as a feasibility study for their ambitions to have independent satellite ISR capabilities.

profile_positions.description:
MSc thesis: Development of a novel hybrid optimization methodology - and the corresponding commercial software prototype - for low-thrust many-revolution satellite trajectories:
• Literature study: analysis state-of-the-art methods and requirements trade-off, 
• Design and implementation of the software prototype architecture (including GUI), 
• Derivations of the numerical modelling and development of the hybrid optimization strategy,
• Validation and performance analysis: the new optima reach the accuracy of analytical methods,
• Optimization and complete integration within GMV's commercial flight dynamics solution, focuSuite,
• Presentation and active promotion of the novel methodology GMV at international symposia.
• Peer reviewed journal publication available at dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.actaastro.2020.06.015
profile_positions.title: (intern) Flight dynamics engineer

profile_positions.description: This was a week-long concurrent design workshop hosted by the ESA Academy at the ESA Redu Center where in a team of 15, we had the chance to further deepen the design of a space mission concept from the Alpbach Summer School. Thanks to the ESA Educational Concurrent Design Facility, our team underwent several design iterations in just a few days to further develop this mission concept to enhance weather predictions through precipitation monitoring at high latitudes. As the communications and co-systems engineer, I got a great insight into ESA's OCDT software and fostering cooperation under stringent time constraints.
profile_positions.title: (student) System engineer and spokesman at Post-Alpbach Summer School

profile_positions.description:
This was a nine-day challenge where our team of 15 identified scientific gaps in current climate models, determined the measurable parameters, and designed a suitable instrument and space mission; namely a constellation of limb sounding satellites to monitor waper-vapour levels in the UTLS region of the atmosphere. As the systems engineer, I was responsible for the mass, power and ΔV budgets. Additionally, I designed the propulsion, power, and on-board computer subsystems and performed the mission analysis. My team, whose “WAVE-E” concept received the best presentation and science proposal awards, also elected me as team manager and co-presenter. 

The positive feedback from teammates and tutors, who praised me for being an empathetic leader, as well as the advice from jurors, who deemed my contribution outstanding, is what encourages me to pursue a career in space-related projects.
profile_positions.title: (student) System engineer and spokesman at Alpbach Summer School

profile_positions.description:
Assisted professors in grading assignments and exams on several BSc courses and group projects: Spacecraft System Design Project (AE2221-I), Aerospace Design and Systems Engineering (AE2221-II), (AE2223-II) Experimental Research and Data Analysis, 2x Design and Construction (AE1222-I), and 2x Design Synthesis (AE3200).

My duties for the team projects also included:
○ Recommending useful literature to the students and promoting effective research techniques
○ Monitoring and stimulating teamwork dynamics and enhancing their professional development

profile_positions.description:

	○ Mentored an academic project for international students to improve their team work and presentation skills,
	○ Co-organized and coached team-building games, dinners, trips, and tour to help them integrate in the Dutch culture.
profile_positions.title: Mentor International Introduction Programme

profile_positions.description: Developed a Python tool to optimize Earth-based orbit transfers with low-thrust propulsion. It is intended for pre-development studies and uses orbital averaging and an interior point optimization scheme for rapid convergence.
profile_positions.title: (intern) Mission analysis engineer

profile_positions.description:
SoSalsa is a non-profit organization with over 250 active members and a turn-over of 28,000€/yr. Its goal is to create an international open-minded environment that encourages people to develop their dancing skills. Hence, it provides its members with regular lessons, specialized workshops, choreography team training, bonding activities, salsa excursions, and monthly salsa parties.

My responsibilities included:
 ○ Negotiating and managing the purchases by third parties of workshops given by SoSalsa,
 ○ Internal and external communication (sponsors, customers, members, teachers etc.),
 ○ Typing minutes in internal and external meetings, updating action-point lists, and documenting ideas,
 ○ Co-organized a teambuilding weekend for 50 members (location, transport, meals, workshops, activities etc.),
 ○ Co-lead a team of 7 for the summer promotion campaigns (flash-mobs, performances, barbeques, parties etc.),
 ○ Co-started a housing committee to search and negotiate possibilities to acquire our own accommodation.
profile_positions.title: Vice-President and Secretary of the 9th Executive Board

profile_positions.description:
The students in this team from Delft University of Technology design, build and race hydrogen-electric racecars to compete against petrol driven engines to demonstrate the power of green technology and educate students in the design process of complex systems.

I worked part-time on the design and redesign of the (hydrogen-electric) car “Forze VI”. My contribution was improving safety and reliability in two departments:
	○ 2012 - Supension dpt: designed the carbon composite links and connections to the upright and chassis
	○ 2013 - Electronics dpt: redesigned the packaging and cooling system of the electrical accumulator 
	○ Other duties: advertising at engineering fairs with our sponsors and producing parts of the car through machining and turning.
profile_positions.title: (student) Mechanical Engineer

volunteer_experiences.role: Funds-Raising project for Halima Orphan Care (Malawi)
volunteer_experiences.description:
Co-founded and led a team of ten students in a funds-raising project. We raised over 1,100€ for an orphanage in Malawi through the making and selling of hand-made Swarovski jewellery. My contributions were:
○ Co-initiated and promoted the project, recruited team members and the crafts teacher
○ Organized and advertised the sales, managed the revenues and costs
